;While the bathroom maybe the smallest room in your home, it is probably the most important. It can be your own personal haven where you can shut the door and relax or pamper yourself at the end of a long, tiring day. If your bathroom is in need of updating there are many things that you can do to create a pleasant, ambient feel. The bathroom can increase the value of your home if you upgrade it correctly. That is why it is essential that you create the right feel for your bathroom.
;
;It may be that you need to replace the whole bathroom suite, including the bath, shower, toilet and wash basin. Any old or shabby appliances will stand out as these form the basis of the room. There are so many designs that you can choose for your bathroom, from modern to classic, from simple to baroque. You will need to have a budget so that you don't have the cost to upgrade going through the roof. Top of the range bathrooms can be found from companies creating bespoke designs. On the lower and more budget conscious end, you can easily get nice suites on the internet or at high street stores. Besides the design, you need to include the fitting costs into your budget. If you are unable to fit the appliances yourself most companies offer a fitting service but this may cost extra.
;
;If you currently are not able to afford a whole new bathroom, you can do the more inexpensive route. Old taps on a bath or wash basin can be replaced with new modern designs that can be found in any DIY store and can be fitted quite easily. Another option is to replace the old shower curtain with a clear screen, making the bathroom look bigger and cleaner. These options are very affordable and very easy to upgrade. You could also replace the tiles on the wall or floor making your bathroom look even cleaner. Try to ensure that any flooring, whether it is tiles, wood or carpet, is compatible to use in a humid bathroom environment.
;

You can consider what kind of color would match the mood of your bathroom. You could easily enhance the bathroom with bath mats, curtains, blinds or nice fluffy towels. Again, there is a huge choice of these available, so have fun deciding on your look. Splashes of color can be added by pictures on the wall or creating a focal point which could include a potted plant or an arrangement of scented candles. Candles can not only provide color but it can also enhance the aroma of your bathroom. Small and inexpensive added features could also include a new soap dispenser, toilet roll holder or toilet brush which can all be co-ordinated.
;
